document.masterDocTitle: Additions to the Ant Fauna of Turkey (Hymenoptera, Formicidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Additions to the Ant Fauna of Turkey (Hymenoptera, Formicidae)

paragraph.heading:
Solenopsis cf. fugax ( Latreille, 1798 )
/ lusitanica Emery, 1915

subSubSection.paragraph: DISTRIBUTION IN TURKEY . — Afyonkarahisar , Bursa , Çanakkale , Edirne , Eskişehir , İstanbul , Kırklareli , Kocaeli , Sakarya , Trabzon , Yalova .

Recently
Galkowski et al. (2010)
redescribed
S. fugax ( Latreille, 1798 )
. They also indicated four species groups distributed in Europe and the Mediterranean region.
Bračko et al. (2016)
mentioned that in Greece
S. fugax
is less common than
S. lusitanica Emery, 1915a
which dominated lowland and warm areas in the country. On the other hand, both species complexes have many undetermined species (
Bračko et al. 2016
). Therefore, the material is given here as uncertain taxa until taxonomical chaos solved.
